This phenomenon is known as "social contagion" or "mass hysteria," where one person's behavior (in this case, coughing) triggers a similar response in others. This is due to selective attention, where people focus on a particular stimulus (the coughing) and become more aware of their own bodily sensations, leading them to experience similar symptoms.
